content: The "Automobile Fuel Efficiency Improvements Act of 2003" may be cited as the Act. It includes phased increases in fuel economy standards. The "Automobile Fuel Efficiency Improvements Act of 2003" mandates phased increases in fuel economy standards for passenger automobiles, with standards ranging from 25 to 32 miles per gallon based on model year. The fuel economy standards for passenger automobiles are mandated to increase gradually, starting at 28 miles per gallon for model years before 2008, and reaching 40 miles per gallon for model years after 2014.
